description: Removal and replacement of a supporting beam located in between the overhang of room 5 and the external wall 7 (Application for Listed Building Consent).
decision_conditions: Given the lack of information, specifically the lack of provision of a Heritage Statement and Structural Report, the proposal has failed to provide clear and convincing justification for the proposed replacement of the timber beams or that there would be any public benefit or other material consideration arising from the work that would justify the harm to the heritage asset, contrary to the requirements of Policies BE1 and HE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two- Development Management Policies (January 2020), Policy HC1 of the London Plan (March 2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way. We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies from the  Local Plan Part 1, Local Plan Part 2, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service.

In order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition further guidance was offered to the applicant by the case officer during the processing of the application to identify the amendments to address those elements of the scheme considered unacceptable which the applicant chose not to implement.
